content.description:
Sweet technical face. A nice crux lower down leads to some easier climbing, followed by another technical crux getting to jugs which take you to the anchor. This pitch was rescrubbed early 2020 by Nicole Deuchar.

30 seconds right of Giv’er
8 bolts

A novelty climb, Chasing Rainbows climbs a basalt dike that continues underneath Highway 99 to form the Black Dike all the way up the Chief!  After locating the dike, you will have to climb some granite to get there, placing gear along the way. Most of the dike is steep with big holds, with a techy move thrown in there. The angle lessens at the top, and protection opportunities decrease as well, a fall up here would be heinous, but unlikely. When you top out, look for anchors on a slab to the left.

From HWY 99 footbridge, head North (Right) on several trails in the forest until you reach the slabs on top of the Malamute, you should see a pond near the logging business here. Drop down the slabs in a gully, and then head left around the base.  Keep an eye out for the dike, it starts on a steep hillside.
Single rack to #3 Camelot, make sure you have a .75 & .5 for the dike portion. Slings!

Starting of flake boulder climb cracks to gain the nice right facing corner

Just right of pinky locks
Standard

Easy walking up dyke then some solid face climbing to the top of that wall. Pretty good. 
This pitch was given a rescrubbing early 2020 by Nicole Deuchar

15seconds right of pinky locks.
7 bolts

thin seam lead to a pancake flake hard layback crimping with poor feet leads to a trick mantel the easy climbing to the chains.

route video:




small wire/offsets 1x .5 cam 3 bolts

Route featuring some harder slab moves down low, leading to easier climbing through the overlaps, then rightward to the anchor. Not the best but worth doing if you're here for Blue Steel. Boulder is solid as fuck.

Just right of Blue Steel.
5 bolts

This obvious splitter crack is the 2nd route you'll encounter in the Chasing Rainbows area. It is straightforward jamming until it splits into two cracks and it becomes a jug haul. A little mossy. There isn't much reason to be down here unless you're climbing 10+, so I will throw in that you cannot get to the anchors of any other climbs from the top of this one. Left of Coronary Corner. First climb encountered in Chasing Rainbows area. Gear to 2". Two-bolt anchor with chains.

A long journey following a wide, leftward traversing dyke to a layback arete encounter at the end. I bolted this when I was working Emubigs to convince Nicole to come down and belay me a couple times. She did the FA and thought I could have added another bolt or two but the slight run outs are on easy ground. 
Belay just left of 1st tree at start, passing rope around the right side of this tree so climber can start on the right side. Since the FA someone dropped a tree from the ledge above which is now wedged between the wall and one of the trees but the route is still climbable.
Video Here

Just below and the the left of chasing rainbows.
8-9bolts

Short slab featuring some cool pockets and technical moves.

First (or leftmost) route on the chasing rainbows ledge.
4 bolts
A number of climbs off a wide treed ledge about halfway up the Malamute. The top 100 climb chasing rainbows following up a black dyke can be found at the southern end.
